IX.iii.1.J.1.m
.
Example 2:  Convertibility of Assets
Example
:  The Veteran inherited an investment property five years ago.  At that time the property was worth $250,000.  The Veteran demonstrates that, because of depressed land values in the area, the property could be sold today for only $150,000.
Result
:  The value of the property for purposes of a VA net worth determination is $150,000.  The fact that the property was worth substantially more five years ago or might be worth substantially more in the future is irrelevant.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section J - Net Worth, Asset Transfers, and Penalty Periods
